ACT
115
Rights after revocation
A descendant or spouse who had to return to the assignor what he received during the transfer and distribution will be able to claim his necessary share after the assignor's death, if he is not excluded from the inheritance, nor is he unworthy to inherit the assignor, nor has he renounced the inheritance.
When calculating the value of his necessary part, parts of the property that the testator transferred and distributed to his other descendants or spouse during his lifetime will be considered a gift.
